title: Red Currant Pie Recipe
description: This delicious red current pie recipe was given to me from a friend in Germany.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Red Currant Pie 4.4 (54) 44 Reviews 8 Photos I got this red currant pie recipe from a friend in Germany. It's a delicious way to incorporate red currants into your baking. Submitted by Patti-Bigtime Updated on January 12, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Additional Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr 25 mins Servings: 10 Yield: 1 10-inch pie Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings Crust: 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon baking powder ½ cup butter, softened ½ cup white sugar 2 large eggs, separated 1 ½ teaspoons grated lemon zest Filling: ½ cup white sugar 2 teaspoons cornstarch 2 ¼ cups red currants Directions Make the dough: Sift flour and baking powder into a medium bowl. Mix in butter, sugar, egg yolks, and lemon zest until a dough forms. Cover and let rest in a cool place for 30 minutes. Set egg whites aside for the filling. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease the bottom and sides of a 10-inch springform pan. Roll dough into a 10-inch circle; place into the prepared springform pan. Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about 25 minutes. Meanwhile, make the filling: Beat reserved egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until stiff. Gradually mix in sugar and cornstarch, then beat for 5 minutes. Fold in currants, then pour over crust in the springform pan. Return to the oven and bake until top is lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Cool to room temperature before serving. I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 257 Calories 10g Fat 39g Carbs 4g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 10 Calories 257 % Daily Value * Total Fat 10g 13% Saturated Fat 6g 31% Cholesterol 65mg 22% Sodium 115mg 5% Total Carbohydrate 39g 14% Dietary Fiber 2g 6% Total Sugars 22g Protein 4g 7% Vitamin C 11mg 12% Calcium 39mg 3% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 108mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Red Currant Pie 01 of 08 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 08 Photo by  Rmvk 09/26/2016 Fantastic! I made small tarts in 8cm tart pans and they were awesome! The sour taste of the currants is balanced with the sweet meringue and they look super! I dusted them with a bit of icing sugar...alltogether they were a big hit. I used the exact recipe this time, but next time I'll use less sugar in the meringue. One tip: Don't skip the cornstarch, it makes the meringue stickier and more marshmallow-y, so it stays better in the tart pans. 03 of 08 Photo by  Melissa 07/23/2014 I recently moved into a new house with red currant plants. I have never eaten currants and came across this recipe. I tried this recipe tonight and it is delicious! I only wish I had more berries to pick to make this again. When I made the crust, it was very loose, but I packed it down as suggested in another review. 04 of 08 Photo by  Loretta's Recipe Journal 12/16/2013 05 of 08 Photo by  Realma 07/21/2011 06 of 08 Photo by  SunFlower 07/11/2006 A great way to use that abundance of red currants from the garden! I like the sweet and tart combination. The proportions are a bit off, though: for a 9" pan, I used half the crust and I had to double the meringue filling. 07 of 08 Photo by  Lise M 07/01/2006 We had to make this without cornstarch - substituted 4 tsps. of flour. It was still great, didn't even notice all the currant seeds! I think this would be good using other berries, as it lets them stay very fresh-tasting. Also, the crust did seem a bit crumbly, but we just patted into the springform pan and chilled it in the pan - why struggle with rolling it out? 1 You’ll Also Love Easy German Apple Streusel Pie 19 Ratings Zwetschekuchen (German Plum Tart) 10 Ratings Apple Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting 84 Ratings Easy German Apple Sheet Cake 6 Ratings Apfelkuchen 6 Ratings German Apple Sheet Cake 1 Rating Bavarian-Style Apple Torte 15 Ratings German Apple Pudding Cake 38 Ratings Moist German Sheet Pan Apple Cake Nana's Cranberry Kuchen 10 Ratings Schaum Torte 12 Ratings Easy Three-Ingredient Gluten-Free German Christmas Coconut Cookies 3 Ratings Crescent Butter Biscuits 4 Ratings Lebkuchen VI 52 Ratings Chocolate Sauerkraut Cake II 22 Ratings Schokoladenmakronen (Gluten-Free Christmas Chocolate Meringues) 3 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Patti-Bigtime
instructions: Make the dough: Sift flour and baking powder into a medium bowl. Mix in butter, sugar, egg yolks, and lemon zest until a dough forms. Cover and let rest in a cool place for 30 minutes. Set egg whites aside for the filling.;Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease the bottom and sides of a 10-inch springform pan.;Roll dough into a 10-inch circle; place into the prepared springform pan.;Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about 25 minutes.;Meanwhile, make the filling: Beat reserved egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until stiff. Gradually mix in sugar and cornstarch, then beat for 5 minutes. Fold in currants, then pour over crust in the springform pan.;Return to the oven and bake until top is lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Cool to room temperature before serving.
